text: hi everyone Anthony Fantana here the
Internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for review of the new Hopson album
nach madness Hopson is a West Coast MC
who's had a pretty illustrious past
couple of years with a lot of hot
singles coming out through his ill mind
of Hopsin series is a double XL freshmen
alum he has a handful of projects right
now under his belt and he has had a lot
of success through his label funk volume
lately too with some artists like Jarren
Benton and dizzy Wright gaining a lot of
attention and he really doesn't mince
words or worry about what's going to be
offensive to other people and that has
pretty much gained him a very passionate
cult following even if stylistically a
lot of what he does come straight out of
the M&M playbook Hopson just gets a lot
from Eminem when it comes to flow and
delivery and hooks and personality even
the dr. Dre style production on some of
the tracks from this new LP of Hobson's
shows influence from Eminem's earlier
albums and for the most part I do think
Hopson does Eminem's really cartoony rap
style justice he's a really animated MC
is foul-mouthed bars can be pretty
hilarious on some of the more
hard-hitting tracks here however I'm not
really saying that Hobson's brand of
comedy is all that mature or clever or
well-groomed he really kind of shoots
for that cringe style of comedy in the
you know you like I'm an animal [ __ ] a
mink coat [ __ ] wear me or I got balls
like Ash Ketchum or I love Christ but I
guarantee you wouldn't want to cross me
or it's like having sex with a nun what
the heck have you done this handful of
lines only comes from a few tracks on
here but believe me these songs are not
really the exception on this album
everything on here is pretty tasteless
and the thing is that's not even really
my biggest issue with him I think Hobson
is really good and and capable as a
nasty offensive giggle worthy rapper the
issues that I do have with this LP for
one lie with the hooks which I mean with
Eminem being such a big influence on
Hopson and hooks never having been
Eminem's
strong suit Hobson's hooks sometimes are
really just nightmarish they're either
sung in this really melodramatic tone
that is hard to believe and hard not to
laugh at like on tears to snow or dream
forever or what's my purpose sometimes
the singing is just really hand up in a
way that makes it cringe-worthy like on
old friend gimme back my oh man or I
still got love for you where I mean
really that the singing on the course is
kind of excruciating or on jungle bash
where you kind of have the call and
respond hey yeah yeah yeah the hooks are
one thing but when Hopson really starts
to grate on my nerves is when he hops on
some kind of moral high ground and tells
the listener what's what a lot like on
the song what's my purpose which is
essentially a lyrical attack on the
human race and Hopson is pretty harsh on
the shortcomings of people and I think
he has some points on here like people
don't know how to act people don't know
how to handle themselves there's all
this monkey-see monkey-do stuff going on
hivemind
but the thing is what on this track or
on this album in general makes Hopson a
worthy messenger of this point of view
or even somebody who can be a
torchbearer
to fix these problems or bring these
problems to the attention of those who
might actually try to change things
there's also the issue that Hobson's
views on romantic relationships are
completely shot especially with the nice
guy mentality on the song good guys get
left behind not only is the song
cringe-worthy because there's a Twilight
reference in here but there are plenty
of lines on this album that objectify
women which kind of makes it hard for me
to believe Hobson playing into that nice
guy role but still it feels like Hobson
is taking this nice guy mentality pretty
seriously as he details this failed
relationship play-by-play and the whole
time he's just being really bitter
because he couldn't get in this girl's
pants because I guess he was just too
good of a guy and the problem with the
nice guy mentality is that they always
blame their inability to get in a
relationship on everybody on the planet
but themselves and they always come out
the hero too
like when Hopson is saying that he's
paying this girl's way who got pregnant
from this other guy when he was planning
on getting with her first on the song I
still got love for you what nice guys
fail to realize is that maybe they're
not getting laid because they're
insecure bitter whiny and boring I mean
just take the really sick and desperate
emotions that come through on the track
dream forever on this album I can't
imagine anything that would be a bigger
turn off to a level-headed woman nice
guys constantly blame their failures on
women just having bad taste in men and
they fail to even think for a moment
that maybe their issue is that they have
horrible taste in women and are bad
actually gauging whether or not another
woman is interested if they actually
even get the guts to approach that
person you know I don't want to doubt
that life is unfair and I don't want to
doubt that Hopsin has had some traumatic
experiences in his lifetime but the way
he puts his experiences into words just
makes me not want to sympathize ever
there are some tracks on here that
legitimately I think are good I think
are entertaining I think are fun like
the lead single hop is back or give me
that money a hilarious track with Hopson
saying that all these new friends he
makes are constantly trying to get money
from him begging him for money because
he's so famous and popular now then
there is lunchtime cipher which has two
of the more solid features on this
entire album and has just a hilarious
beat it's a great song concept rapping
spitting bars at school between your
friends and then there is hip-hop
sinister which is easily the angriest
most just frothing at the mouth track on
this entire album and I actually thought
it was it was great definitely a
highlight on here but there are even
some shortcomings on the more upbeat
tracks on here honestly on this thing
overall the production and the hooks are
just weak weak weak and Hopson doesn't
do anything with his punchlines his
views on life or his personality to make
up for that
he's occasionally entertaining with how
empty is and how zany he is and how he
goes at other people like I love the
verses when he was making fun of Kanye
and Kendrick but he is way too obsessed
with dropping jewels for a guy whose
life view
is just too bitter and warped to be
taking notes from if you are copying off
of Hobson's paper you are probably not
going to pass this class I am feeling a
strong three to a light four on this
thing transition if you've given this
album a listen what did you think of it
did you love it hate it why what do you
think I should review next and that's it
Anthony fan tanto Hopson
nock madness forever
